list-item.label: a)
list-item.p: Safety signs and labels shall be provided in accordance with ISO 9244 or ISO 3864-2.

non-normative-note.label: NOTE
non-normative-note.p: Registered safety signs are found in ISO 7010.

list-item.label: b)
list-item.p: The instruction handbook shall indicate the location and content of safety signs and other instructions that appear on the machine. For examples see ISO 6750:2005, Figure 3.

non-normative-note.label: NOTE
non-normative-note.p: ISO 6750 is currently under revision. Figure 3 will be updated to reflect current ISO 9244 safety labels.

list-item.label: c)
list-item.p: A remotely controlled or unmanned, automatically operated rig shall be equipped with signs warning that the rig is remotely or automatically operated. For guidance, see ISO 15817.

list-item.label: d)
list-item.p: Any circuits presenting a hazard and still connected to their energy sources when the mains power is switched off shall have a warning label.

list-item.label: e)
list-item.p: Maximum allowed gradient angle for slopes when tramming or drilling shall be given clearly visible at the driver’s and operator’s position and be explained in the instruction manual.
